ratings.comment: It's been two years since I took this class and some of the profound conversations I've had with him in and out of class really stuck with me. Max is bright and highly well-read, so I hope you get the chance to talk to him at some point, even if you never take his class.

Class usually consisted of mostly incoherent ramblings about topics/semantics that often didn't relate to the concepts of the course. Also, the class was extremely disorganized with poor communication about due dates/office hours.

Max is one of the most helpful and knowledgable professors I have had at the university. Read the books he assigns and listen to his lecture. Everything connects if you actually do the reading. We only had to write two papers in this class. The assigned readings are definitely manageable. Take this class!!
Great Professor! Keeps the interests of the students in front of his own. Makes time to meet his students during office hours. Really loves the subject and has a passion for discussing the topics.

Max is the man.  Yes, he seems tangential, but in his head somewhere he made a connection, and it will hit you while you're sitting around a table enjoying some beer with the people in your class at the Union.  Don't miss out on this professor.

Lectures in seminar form, somewhat disorganized but Max is an extraordinarily knowledgeable and well-read professor.  This class changed my view of the world completely.  Go to his office hours; ask him questions and read the books he assigns.  We had to write one paper for the entire semester, but spent all semester working on it! Take this class.

Max is brilliant and humorous.  His accent and cultural experience give him character.  His lectures are unorganized but fascinating.  It is impossible to write down/remember everything he says.  Easy grader, as long as you put intellectual thought into essays.  If you enjoy lit and random lectures, take Max! If you need structure, don't!

Max is a very pleasant teacher, not tough, always approachable and friendly. He  is well-read in 5 or 6 languages, and will casually leave dozens of references & ideas for you to pick up, (sometimes on topic sometimes off), especially classics, continental philosophy, and lit. theory. Eccentric, entertaining, a European intellectual par excellence.
Max is the best tangent ranter on earth, we may not get through everything but I always enjoy it

simple don't have to go to class kind of teach. he's super sweet and gives you good stuff to read pretty much only if you want to.  wrote like 2 papers, maybe one? and a few quizzes where he reinterated the facts like 80 times so if you go to class at all you'll get the info

Max is the sweetest, nicest, smartest guy ever. I recommend any class you can take with him.m He's extremely intelligent, and he likes to get to know his students. If you take the time to get to know him, you'll find out he's a crazy, fun, ice-skating, comparative literature machine.

MOST BORING CLASS EVER!!! I was interested in the topic when I signed up for the class, but I just couldn't handle going. He knows what he is talking about, but goes off on tangents - not organized at all.

Gets off topic A LOT! He makes up for his lack of clarity and teaching ability with easy grading. If you really need an A and want to read good books take the class, if you want to learn, find someone else.
good guy. hard to follow sometimes, but the class really isnt hard at all. lectures were actually kinda fun

crazy genius, really nice guy too.  Funny accent, but definitely understandable.  Don't plan on easy-to-follow lectures, he jumps around a lot, but you don't really need the info for any sort of test, so it's not a big deal.
Basically the smartest person you will ever meet.  Take his classes if you have the chance.
